Posts.Content: after 2 years clean slate my wife complained of pain in side. we got her a cat scan to find plenty to worry about. the path report reads leisions too numerous to count on liver , lungs, ribcage, and spine, potential single lieson on brain but wife is extreme claustrophobic and wont MRI.  all that i read says prognosis is bad. is my level of concern in the right place? are we prolonging the inevitable with chemo? my wife also doesnt liek advice she is strong wiled and confuses advice and information with direction and orders. doc is neutral on any time relationship and she has recieved her first round of chemo for the reoccurance.. my head is spinning and i don't know what to tell her or our 17 year old son...i feel so lost and helpless... Hi Dave...I am so sorry to hear of your wife's diagnosis.  She will be in my prayers. (as well as, the rest of your family)  your level of concern is warranted, and all I can suggest is that you include your son within your decisions.  Your wife sounds just like my mother - strong willed and even somewhat stubborn.  I am on the other side of the coin - i just learned my dad has cancer, and have not be included on earlier discussions about his health.  It is hurtful...
Posts.Title: reoccuring breast cancer
